One movie that comes to mind based on the preferences you've given me is "The Talented Mr. Ripley." This classic film, directed by Roman Polanski, stars Al Pacino as Tom Ripley, a successful but unsatisfied businessman who decides to go on vacation in Italy instead of continuing his work back home in America.

In Italy, Ripley meets and becomes infatuated with Dickie Greenleaf, the rich and spoiled millionaire playboy who lives on a luxurious yacht moored near the coast of Italy.

Ripley soon realizes that he cannot continue his infatuation with Dickie Greenleaf without also falling under the influence of the corrupt and dangerous businessman who actually owns and controls the luxurious yacht moored near the coast of Italy.

In an attempt to escape the consequences of his own corruption and dishonesty, Ripley decides to kidnap Dickie Greenleaf in Italy instead of continuing his work back home in America.

Ripley soon realizes that he cannot continue his kidnapping of Dickie Greenleaf without also falling under the influence as a mentally ill criminal who must be held accountable for his crimes.
